class.name: KickUsersRequests
class.brief_description: Handles Kick API requests related to users.
class.description:
KickUsersRequests provides methods for retrieving user information from the Kick API. Access this handler through [method KickAPI.get_users]. [codeblocks] [gdscript] func _ready(): KickAPI.configure("your_token") KickAPI.request_completed.connect(_on_request_completed)
# Get authenticated user KickAPI.get_users().get_users()
# Get user by username KickAPI.get_users().get_users({"username": ["streamer123", "gamer456"]})
# Get users by ID KickAPI.get_users().get_users({"user_id": [12345, 67890]})
func _on_request_completed(signal_name: String, response_code: int, data: Dictionary): if signal_name == "users_received": # Output: # { # "data": [ # { # "user_id": 12345, # "name": "streamer123", # "email": "user@example.com", # "profile_picture": "https://..." # }, # { # "user_id": 67890, # "name": "gamer456", # "email": "gamer@example.com", # "profile_picture": "https://..." # } # ], # "message": "success" # } for user in data["data"]: print("User: ", user["name"]) print(" ID: ", user["user_id"]) print(" Email: ", user["email"]) print(" Profile: ", user["profile_picture"]) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: get_users
method.description: Retrieves user information. The [param params] dictionary can include: - [code]user_id[/code]: Array of user IDs (up to 50) - [code]username[/code]: Array of usernames (up to 50, max 25 chars each) If no parameters are provided, returns information for the authenticated user. You cannot mix [code]user_id[/code] and [code]username[/code] parameters. Results are returned via the [signal KickAPI.request_completed] signal with signal_name [code]"users_received"[/code].
